{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kiesselbach's plexus, also known as Little's area, is an anastomotic network of blood vessels in the anterior part of the nasal septum. It is supplied by four arteries: the sphenopalatine artery, the anterior ethmoidal artery, the greater palatine artery, and the septal branch of the superior labial artery. Therefore, all of the options listed are branches of the external carotid artery in Kiesselbach's plexus.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
